video.title: Farscape
video.synopsis: After he's flung across the cosmos, an astronaut finds refuge aboard a sentient vessel populated by alien fugitives fleeing a despotic military force.

episodes.synopsis: Astronaut John Crichton, on an experimental space mission, is accidentally hurled across the universe to the midst of an intergalactic conflict.
episodes.title: Premiere

episodes.synopsis: Space cockroaches that can replicate other life forms infest Moya. Crichton attempts to save Aeryn's life as the ship's temperature rises.
episodes.title: Exodus from Genesis

episodes.synopsis: A sensual female alien seduces D'Argo and Crichton to obtain a weapon of mass destruction. Crichton experiences mental flashes of the future.
episodes.title: Back and Back and Back to the Future

episodes.synopsis: Rygel takes a crystal essential to Moya's survival for trade with the Tavleks, battle-scarred renegades whose real business is kidnapping.
episodes.title: Throne for a Loss

episodes.synopsis: To save Moya from attack by a race of scavengers, Crichton and a female Peacekeeper tech, left behind by Capt. Crais, join forces.
episodes.title: PK Tech Girl

episodes.synopsis: D'Argo and Zhaan are influenced by the tannot plant, a root that obscures all individual thought and rules the lives of each worker.
episodes.title: Thank God It's Friday, Again

episodes.synopsis: To avoid being traced by the Peacekeepers, Moya is forced to crash-land on a planet whose inhabitants are unaware of extraterrestrial life.
episodes.title: I, E.T

episodes.synopsis: An evil sorcerer tricks Crichton and Crais into a deadly confrontation. To save Crichton, Zhaan must rekindle spiritual powers buried long ago.
episodes.title: That Old Black Magic

episodes.synopsis: Moya's crew seeks a scientist who can provide star charts to their home worlds. His intentions are revealed when Aeryn begins evolving into Pilot.
episodes.title: DNA Mad Scientist

episodes.synopsis: A routine maintenance check on Moya causes D'Argo to relive flashbacks from his past, which reveal the truth behind his Peacekeeper imprisonment.
episodes.title: They've Got a Secret

episodes.synopsis: Crichton and Aeryn experiment with re-creating a wormhole, but their plans are derailed by ferocious wolflike bounty hunters.
episodes.title: Till the Blood Runs Clear

episodes.synopsis: An invisible net in space traps Crichton and Aeryn -- but to escape, one of them must die.
episodes.title: The Flax

episodes.synopsis: Zhaan's priesthood is in jeopardy when a Delvian sect tries to steal her soul.
episodes.title: Rhapsody in Blue

episodes.synopsis: Crichton makes a new life on a utopic world but becomes the "other man" in a dangerous romantic triangle.
episodes.title: Jeremiah Crichton

episodes.synopsis: A Peacekeeper commander who once tormented Rygel in prison resurfaces after his mind has undergone a "mental cleansing" -- or has it?
episodes.title: Durka Returns

episodes.synopsis: Crichton returns home to find that the wormhole he traveled through never closed and that Earth has been vastly affected by it.
episodes.title: A Human Reaction

episodes.synopsis: Crichton races to reunite Moya's passengers, who are stuck in different dimensions from an otherworldly alien.
episodes.title: Through the Looking Glass

episodes.synopsis: Peacekeeper commandos and the crew of Moya join forces against an invisible but deadly virus.
episodes.title: A Bug's Life

episodes.synopsis: To save Aeryn's life, Crichton infiltrates a Peacekeeper base but soon faces torture in the form of an alien electric chair and his enemy Crais.
episodes.title: Nerve

episodes.synopsis: The crew of Moya attempts to save Crichton from death at the hands of Crais and the Peacekeepers.
episodes.title: The Hidden Memory

episodes.synopsis: Moya and her unsuspecting crew encounter a carnivorous alien.
episodes.title: Bone to Be Wild

episodes.synopsis: In hot pursuit of Moya's crew, Scorpius and Capt. Crais set in motion events that will leave all our heroes fighting for their lives.
episodes.title: Family Ties

episodes.synopsis: Crichton, Aeryn and D'Argo are stranded in an asteroid field while Scorpius searches for them. Their safety depends on Crais, who is nearby in Talyn.
episodes.title: Mind the Baby

episodes.synopsis: D'Argo searches for a dying Luxan, Nilaam. She's a holy woman who wants D'Argo to help her die. But then Nilaam sees a chance to alter her fate.
episodes.title: Vitas Mortis

episodes.synopsis: Distraught at the death of her brother, Chiana joins a gang of nihilistic young aliens. Crichton, Aeryn and Rygel try to talk Chiana into coming back.
episodes.title: Taking the Stone

episodes.synopsis: The crew returns from a planet with a meek alien called Traltixx, who promises he can alter Moya's electromagnetics to make her untraceable.
episodes.title: Crackers Don't Matter

episodes.synopsis: A datacam tape shows Aeryn as part of a firing squad that executed a previous pilot. The crew wants answers, but Aeryn won't revisit her past.
episodes.title: The Way We Weren't

episodes.synopsis: Chiana returns to Moya with a fortune-telling portrait. The picture foretells the deaths of each of the crew, and one by one, they start to die off.
episodes.title: Picture If You Will

episodes.synopsis: The crew heads for a mining colony. When they arrive, they must contend with the camp's overlord. Each of the crew goes to work to obtain supplies.
episodes.title: Home on the Remains

episodes.synopsis: While searching for news of Crichton, Moya's crew find themselves on the planet Litigara -- a world where lawyers comprise most of the population.
episodes.title: Dream a Little Dream

episodes.synopsis: When Moya is attacked by Halos-1, the crew discovers that they have all swapped minds. Zhaan, on a diplomatic mission, is the only one unaffected.
episodes.title: Out of Their Minds

episodes.synopsis: A mysterious energy sphere implants itself inside Moya and envelops Crichton. When Aeryn fires upon it, it ejects not one, but three Crichtons.
episodes.title: My Three Crichtons

episodes.synopsis: The crew travels to a planet under the rule of a benevolent monarchy. The queen-to-be has had her DNA altered by agents working for her brother.
episodes.title: Look at the Princess: Part 1: A Kiss Is but a Kiss

episodes.synopsis: Agents working for Clavor try to assassinate Crichton, but they're thwarted by a Peacekeeper on a mission to stop Clavor from taking the throne.
episodes.title: Look at the Princess: Part 2: I Do, I Think

episodes.synopsis: Crichton and Katralla are frozen so that they may watch over the governments of the next 80 cycles. Clavor and Cargn attempt another assassination.
episodes.title: Look at the Princess: Part 3: The Maltese Crichton

episodes.synopsis: Chiana returns with a cute little creature called a Vorc. When D'Argo is attacked by a beast, the crew uses the Vorc to track down the unwanted guest.
episodes.title: Beware of Dog

episodes.synopsis: Crichton is on Earth, safely returned from his failed Farscape mission. Crichton then starts seeing the crew of Moya in various earthbound guises.
episodes.title: Won't Get Fooled Again

episodes.synopsis: Aeryn appears on board from a planetary visit, having aged 160 cycles. With Moya stuck in time, she returns to the planet, and Crichton must follow.
episodes.title: The Locket

episodes.synopsis: Crais announces that he's going to remove the Talyn gunship's weapons and replace them with a non-lethal Plokavian weapon called a dampening net.
episodes.title: The Ugly Truth

episodes.synopsis: Aeryn and Rygel bring onto Moya two Nebari survivors of a Peacekeeper attack. The Nebari mind-cleanse the crew, and only Crichton is unaffected.
episodes.title: A Clockwork Nebari

episodes.synopsis: Stark returns with a plan to buy slaves including D'Argo's son, Jothee. He proposes that the crew rob a shadow depository run by Natira.
episodes.title: Liars, Guns and Money: Part 1: A Not So Simple Plan

episodes.synopsis: Moya's crew escapes the depository, but the currency turns out to be insectoid creatures that eat Moya. Scorpius has purchased the enslaved Jothee.
episodes.title: Liars, Guns and Money: Part 2: With Friends Like These..

episodes.synopsis: Crichton has given himself up in exchange for D'Argo's son. The crew mounts a rescue, hoping also to steal enough loot to pay off the mercenaries.
episodes.title: Liars, Guns and Money: Part 3: Plan B

episodes.synopsis: The crew seeks the help of a famous surgeon to remove the neural chip from Crichton's brain. However, the Scorpius clone takes over Crichton's mind.
episodes.title: Die Me, Dichotomy

episodes.synopsis: Scorpius's neural chip has been removed, but Crichton doesn't care: Aeryn is dead, his power of speech is gone and Scorpius's personality remains.
episodes.title: Season of Death

episodes.synopsis: The crew heads to a commerce station to spend their heist money, but the station is damaged by a violent storm, ensnaring Moya in the docking cables.
episodes.title: Suns and Lovers

episodes.synopsis: While searching for a planet to heal the Zhaan, Moya collides and fuses with a small spacecraft, trapping both ships in a series of looping wormholes.
episodes.title: Self Inflicted Wounds: Part 1: Could'a, Would'a, Should'a

episodes.synopsis: Neeyala's crew has been sabotaging Moya and hastening her disintegration. Crichton and the crew battle the saboteurs and a deadly alien serpent.
episodes.title: Self Inflicted Wounds: Part 2: Wait for the Wheel

episodes.synopsis: Crichton and the crew are pulled back in time during a siege between Peacekeepers and the Venek, and every action is changing the course of history.
episodes.title: ...Different Destinations

episodes.synopsis: With their transport pod damaged, the crew must land on a Leviathan ship with a Peacekeeper control collar.
episodes.title: Eat Me

episodes.synopsis: Crichton has been cloned. Moya's crew, trying to buy a healing agent for the injured gunship Talyn, becomes embroiled in a planet's deadly politics.
episodes.title: Thanks for Sharing

episodes.synopsis: When Talyn is swallowed by a giant space creature, Crais's neural connection to Talyn malfunctions, and he asks Aeryn to help him control the gunship.
episodes.title: Green Eyed Monster

episodes.synopsis: After passing through a magnetic cluster, the crew experience blackouts, and Pilot has been possessed by a being pursuing an evil "energy rider."
episodes.title: Losing Time

episodes.synopsis: The Peacekeeper Retrieval Squad lead by Aeryn's mother, Xhalax Sun, traces the crew of Talyn to a jungle planet where the gunship is recuperating.
episodes.title: Relativity

episodes.synopsis: With his research stalling, Scorpius inserts the original neurochip into his own brain, hoping to make contact with the clone of John's personality.
episodes.title: Incubator

episodes.synopsis: Talyn draws dangerously close to a star, pulled by some mysterious force. Two alien beings appear on board: the Sierjna and her captor, Mu-Quillus.
episodes.title: Meltdown

episodes.synopsis: The crew are on a pleasure planet for some rest. When Chiana and Jool go missing, an alien with information on their whereabouts approaches Crichton.
episodes.title: Scratch 'n' Sniff

episodes.synopsis: An Ancient appears and accuses Crichton of sharing wormhole technology with the Charrids, a vicious race that formed an alliance with the Scarrans.
episodes.title: Infinite Possibilities: Part 1: Daedalus Demands

episodes.synopsis: The Ancient "Jack" unlocks the secrets to wormhole technology in Crichton's mind, allowing them to build a weapon that can destroy the Scarran.
episodes.title: Infinite Possibilities: Part 2: Icarus Abides

episodes.synopsis: D'Argo and Crichton's fight ends with Crichton being knocked out cold. The Scorpius clone in Crichton's mind tries to convince him to exact revenge.
episodes.title: Revenging Angel

episodes.synopsis: Grieving for Crichton, Aeryn meets a man who claims to be her father and puts her in touch with a creature who's able to contact the dead Crichton.
episodes.title: The Choice

episodes.synopsis: Moya picks up a badly damaged Leviathan transport pod carrying a Scarran, an Hynerian and a Nebari -- all escaped prisoners -- and their hostage.
episodes.title: Fractures

episodes.synopsis: Rygel and D'Argo meet with Scorpius and Braca in order to negotiate Crichton's safe passage onto the command carrier.
episodes.title: I-Yensch, You-Yensch

episodes.synopsis: The crew boards Scorpius thinking Crichton is there to master wormhole technology. Aeryn and Crais confront past lives. The crew encounters hostility.
episodes.title: Into the Lion's Den: Part 1: Lambs to the Slaughter

episodes.synopsis: Crichton is making breakthroughs in his wormhole research. His crewmates are not so sure about its success and are debating whether to leave or stay.
episodes.title: Into the Lion's Den: Part 2: Wolf in Sheep's Clothing

episodes.synopsis: Moya transports the remains of Talyn to a sacred Leviathan burial ground. Crichton dreams of returning to Earth with Aeryn, but Aeryn is unsure.
episodes.title: Dog with Two Bones

episodes.synopsis: Crichton ekes out an existence aboard Elack, a Leviathan. However, a female alien and mercenaries are intent on harvesting Elack's neural tissue.
episodes.title: Crichton Kicks

episodes.synopsis: The crew is reunited at an archaeological site, looking for a missing probe that may reverse the planet's dangerous atmospheric conditions.
episodes.title: What Was Lost: Part 1: Sacrifice

episodes.synopsis: D'Argo and Sikozu come up with a plan to crash Elack onto the Peacekeeper pursuit craft. But to ensure success, Crichton must consort with Grayza.
episodes.title: What Was Lost: Part 2: Resurrection

episodes.synopsis: The crew is separated by an elaborate trap that leaves half the members in lava-filled caves, while Chiana and Sikozu are left outside with the ship.
episodes.title: Lava's a Many Splendored Thing

episodes.synopsis: The crew is reunited on Moya, where Crichton finds Aeryn suffering from heat delirium and under the care of Scorpius -- who wants asylum aboard Moya.
episodes.title: Promises

episodes.synopsis: Crichton predicts a wormhole's appearance, but a space plant captures the Leviathan. An attack only succeeds in sending the plant into Moya.
episodes.title: Natural Election

episodes.synopsis: Chiana and Crichton are sucked into a game world ruled by a virtual Stark. To escape, they must battle friends and enemies in fantastic guises.
episodes.title: John Quixote

episodes.synopsis: The crew is captured except for Crichton and Noranti. The intruders imprison them in their torsos; if Crichton harms them, they'll injure his friends.
episodes.title: I Shrink Therefore I Am

episodes.synopsis: The Moya crew lands on a planet divided by clan warfare. After experiencing hallucinations, Aeryn is coerced into assassinating a clan leader.
episodes.title: A Prefect Murder

episodes.synopsis: While quarantined above the planet Khurtanan, the crew find their food's been poisoned and they're being blackmailed in exchange for the antidote.
episodes.title: Coup by Clam

episodes.synopsis: Sucked inside a wormhole, a being sends Crichton through "realities" of past events to show how risky it can be to misuse wormhole knowledge.
episodes.title: Unrealized Reality

episodes.synopsis: The crew travels through a wormhole to 1985 Earth. Learning his dad will fly the doomed Challenger mission, Crichton tries to reverse the timeline.
episodes.title: Kansas

episodes.synopsis: The crew returns to Moya in orbit around Earth and find Earth dignitaries awaiting them. The aliens soon find life in the public eye difficult.
episodes.title: Terra Firma

episodes.synopsis: Chiana purchases an abused slave girl. But when the crew begins acting strangely, they realize the girl may not be as innocent as she first appeared.
episodes.title: Twice Shy

episodes.synopsis: At an an advanced-training camp, D'Argo comes face to face with Macton, the Peacekeeper who murdered his wife and then framed him for the crime.
episodes.title: Mental as Anything

episodes.synopsis: Aeryn and Sikozu witness the landing of a Peacekeeper squad. To elude the searching Peacekeepers, Chiana and Noranti undergo genetic manipulation.
episodes.title: Bringing Home the Beacon

episodes.synopsis: Sikozu is sure the secret base Katratzi is where the Scarrans took Aeryn. Crichton has heard of the unrecorded base -- but can't remember where.
episodes.title: A Constellation of Doubt

episodes.synopsis: Jenek must know if Aeryn is carrying Crichton's baby. To locate Aeryn, Crichton and Scorpius travel to an "unrealized reality" version of Moya.
episodes.title: Prayer

episodes.synopsis: Moya's crew tracks Aeryn on a freighter at a Scarran border station. To keep the vessel docked, Noranti releases a deadly, contagious disease.
episodes.title: We're So Screwed: Part 1: Fetal Attraction

episodes.synopsis: The crew discover where Scorpius is held and plan to incite a clash between Kalish and Charrid forces, hoping the diversion will help them free him.
episodes.title: We're So Screwed: Part 2: Hot to Katratzi

episodes.synopsis: Scorpius denies that he's a spy and demands Crichton's help to destroy a cavern of Scarran flora, claiming it will provide a better means of escape.
episodes.title: We're So Screwed: Part 3: La Bomba

episodes.synopsis: Crichton learns of the Scarrans' intention to invade Earth. He comes up with a way to collapse the wormhole to Earth -- but he can't do it alone.
episodes.title: Bad Timing
